item.title: Brett add a quote by Marcel Duchamp
item.description: "The individual, man as a man, man as a brain, if you like, interests me more than what he makes, because I've noticed that most artists only repeat themselves. " -- Marcel Duchamp

item.title: Brett add a quote by Alan Pauls
item.description: "...the great theme of the private journal in the 20th century is sickness." -- Alan Pauls

item.title: Brett add a quote by Antonin Artaud
item.description: "For nothing bestializes a being like the taste for eternal happiness, the search for eternal happiness at any price, and mademoiselle Lucifer is that slut who never wanted to abandon eternal happiness." -- Antonin Artaud

item.title: Brett add a quote by Peter Saville
item.description: "Pop culture used to be like LSD – different, eye-opening and reasonably dangerous. It’s now like crack – isolating, wasteful and with no redeeming qualities whatsoever." -- Peter Saville

item.title: Brett add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Pasteboard pies and paper flowers are being banished from the stage by the growth of that power of accurate observation which is commonly called cynicism by those who have not got it...." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Brett add a quote by Stéphane Mallarmé
item.description: "A roll of the dice will never abolish chance." -- Stéphane Mallarmé

item.title: Brett add a quote by Julio Cortazar
item.description: "Now I am an axolotl." -- Julio Cortazar

item.title: Brett add a quote by Grant Morrison
item.description: "From now on, I'm opting for ontological terrorism." -- Grant Morrison

item.title: Brett add a quote by Grant Morrison
item.description: "Metaphor is one of a group of problem-solving medicines known as figures of speech which are normally used to treat literal thinking and other diseases." -- Grant Morrison

item.title: Brett add a quote by Donna Tartt
item.description: "Does such a thing as "the fatal flaw," that showy dark crack running down the middle of a life, exist outside literature?" -- Donna Tartt

item.title: Brett add a quote by Paul Auster
item.description: "We construct a narrative for ourselves, and that's the thread that we follow from one day to the next. People who disintegrate as personalities are the ones who lose that thread." -- Paul Auster

item.title: Brett add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description:
"The truth about the world, he said, is that anything is possible. Had you not seen it all from birth and thereby bled it of its strangeness it would appear to you for what it is, a hat trick in a medicine show, a fevered dream, a trance bepopulate with chimeras having neither analogue nor precedent, an itinerant carnival, a migratory tentshow whose ultimate destination after many a pitch in many a mudded field is unspeakable and calamitous beyond reckoning.
The universe is no narrow thing and the order within it is not constrained by any latitude in its conception to repeat what exists in one part in any other part. Even in this world more things exist without our knowledge than with it and the order in creation which you see is that which you have put there, like a string in a maze, so that you shall not lose your way. For existence has its own order and that no man's mind can compass, that mind itself being but a fact among others." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Brett add a quote by Marcel Duchamp
item.description: "All this twaddle, the existence of God, atheism, determinism, liberation, societies, death, etc., are pieces of a chess game called language, and they are amusing only if one does not preoccupy oneself with 'winning or losing this game of chess." -- Marcel Duchamp

item.title: Brett add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Gods suppressed become devils, and often it is these devils whom we first encounter when we turn inward." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Brett add a quote by Georges Bataille
item.description: "I believe that truth has only one face: that of a violent contradiction." -- Georges Bataille

item.title: Brett add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "All language is but a poor translation." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Brett add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Believing in progress does not mean believing that any progress has yet been made." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Brett add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "To refute him is to become contaminated with unreality." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Brett add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "A book is more than a verbal structure or series of verbal structures; it is the dialogue it establishes with its reader and the intonation it imposes upon his voice and the changing and durable images it leaves in his memory. A book is not an isolated being: it is a relationship, an axis of innumerable relationships." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Brett add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "It may be that universal history is the history of the different intonations given a handful of metaphors." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Brett add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "In the critic's vocabulary, the word "precursor" is indispensable, but it should be cleansed of all connotations of polemic or rivalry. The fact is that every writer creates his own precursors. His work modifies our conception of the past, as it will modify the future." -- Essay: "Kafka and his Precursors" -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Brett add a quote by John Hodgman
item.description: "I still have a fondness for books. Many a time I will be antiquing, and I'll say, 'What's that old-timey curio over there? What is that, a candlestick telephone, one of those old pull-chain toilets? Oh no, it's a book. I used to help make those things! I will buy it and use it to decorate my chain of casual family-dining restaurants." -- John Hodgman

item.title: Brett add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "The ultimate meaning to which all stories refer has two faces: the continuity of life, the inevitability of death." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Brett add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "The sea where living creatures were at one time immersed is now enclosed within their bodies." -- Italo Calvino
